subject: JNI (Shudder!)
msgSnippet: OK, I m stumped.  When a test class that loads a DLL is not in a package, it runs successfully.  When the test class is put into a package -- as all good
messageBody:
OK, I'm stumped. When a test class that loads a DLL is not in a
package, it runs successfully. When the test class is put into a
package -- as all good classes should be -- it fails to load the DLL.
(The same holds true if the test class delegates to another non-test
class that loads the DLL.)

Example that works:

----

import junit.framework.*;

public class MyTestCase extends TestCase {

public static native void runMyDLL();

static {
System.loadLibrary("MyDLL") ;
}

public void testRun() {
runMyDLL() ;
}
}

> java junit.textui.TestRunner MyTestCase

.
Time: 0.01
OK (1 test)

----

Example that doesn't work:

package com.xyz;

import junit.framework.*;

public class MyTestCasePackaged extends TestCase {

public static native void runMyDLL();

static {
System.loadLibrary("MyDLL") ;
}

public void testRun() {
runMyDLL() ;
}
}

> java junit.textui.TestRunner com.xyz.MyTestCasePackaged

.E
Time: 0.01
There was 1 error:
1) testRun(com.xyz.MyTestCasePackaged)java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError:
runMyDLL
at com.xyz.MyTestCasePackaged.runMyDLL(Native Method)
at com.xyz.MyTestCasePackaged.testRun(MyTestCasePackaged.java:14)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.
invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.
invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)

FAILURES!!!
Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1

----

Is this a known problem with JUnit or a known problem with my
understanding of JNI?

I really want to think it's the latter. I'm going to be really surprised
if I'm the first person to run into this. The list archives contain one
mention of an Oracle thick driver suffering a similar problem, but a
search of "UnsatisfiedLinkError" didn't turn up much. And I've played
the excluded.properties tricks - adding "com.xyz.*" to the list.

Anyway, I'm prepared to be educated by someone.

Thanks!

Mike

--
